intro: Cyclopogon taquaremboensis, commonly known as the Taquarembo cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to Uruguay. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
